post.description: Generate a new, on-demand, smart reply between a business and a client. For example, when a user wants to edit their own reply text, provide custom instructions, or modify a previously-generated AI reply. **Available for Staff tokens**

get.description: Retrieve a list of smart replies with optional filtering. **Available for Staff tokens**

200.description: List of smart replies retrieved successfully

get.description: Retrieve a specific smart reply by its unique identifier. **Available for Staff tokens**

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the AISmartReply

get.description: Retrieve a list of AIRecommendations with optional filtering by status, target, and context. **Available for Staff tokens**

post.description: Create a new AIRecommendation. **Available for Staff tokens**

get.description: Retrieve a specific AIRecommendation by UID. **Available for Staff tokens**

put.description: Update an existing AIRecommendation by UID. **Available for Staff tokens**

get.description: Retrieve a specific AIRecommendedAction by UID. **Available for Staff tokens**

post.description: Submit feedback for AI-generated content. **Available for Staff tokens**

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Filter feedback created after this date (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: to_date

get.summary: Get AI generation feedback by UID

parameters.name: uid

Update AI settings for a specific staff member based on their unique identifier.

parameters.name: staff_uid

matter_uid.description: The unique identifier of the associated matter

user_input_reference_id.description: The unique identifier of the user input reference

custom_instructions.description: Optional custom instructions to guide the AI reply generation

actions.description: A list of recommended actions related to this entity.

display.description: Contains display-related information for the recommendation.

title.description: A human-readable title describing the recommendation.

context.description: The context in which the recommendation was generated.

context_uid.description: A unique identifier for the context associated with this recommendation.

target.description: The target entity for this recommendation, typically representing the user or business involved.

target_actor_uid.description: A unique identifier for the target actor (e.g., a user or business).

dismissed.description: Indicates whether the recommendation has been dismissed.
Indicates whether the recommendation has been dismissed.

action.description:
The type of action recommended. Possible values:
- 'reply': Suggests responding to a user message.
- 'estimate': Suggests providing a price estimate.
- 'schedule': Suggests scheduling an appointment or meeting.

display.description: Contains display-related information for the recommendation.

btn_text.description: A human-readable title describing the recommendation.

reason.description: The reason why this action is recommended, providing context for decision-making.

payload.description: Additional data related to the recommended action. The structure depends on the action type.

evidence.description: A list of supporting statements or facts justifying the recommendation.

value.description: The feedback value - stored as string regardless of feedback type (e.g., '4.5' for decimal, 'true' for boolean)

entity_type.description: The type of entity this feedback is related to

entity_uid.description: The unique identifier of the related entity

name.description: The specific name/identifier for the feedback type

ai_recommendations.description: AI recommendations settings configuration for a staff member

enable.description: Whether AI recommendations are enabled for this staff member

sub_options.description: Specific AI recommendation sub-options that can be enabled or disabled individually

next_best_action.description: Whether next best action recommendations are enabled

actor_uid.description: Unique identifier (UID) of the user that created the chat

metadata.description: JSON string used to pass additional information to the chat agent in runtime

example.instruction: You are a helpful assistant. Answer all questions to the best of your ability

updated_at.description: Date the chat was last updated

instruction.description: A prompt describing the basic instructions for the agent. The instructions are set at the beginning of a chat and set the tone and functionality for the entire conversation.
instruction.example: You are an experienced business consultant with a friendly voice. Answer shortly and ask questions where more information is needed.

model_name.description: OpenAI model name to use for the agent

agent.description:
The agent code name. 

Available values: 
* vanilla - No business info included in the conversation
* biz-ai - Seed information on the business is included, as well as a set of instructions to make the bot behave like a biz-ai chat.

content.example: Hello, how can I help you?

author_role.description: Role of the author of the message

updated_at.description: Date the message was last updated

text.description: The text sent to the bot

uid.description: The uid of the prompt you wish to use

variables.description: A key-value object listing values of variables you want BizAI to replace in the prompt. For more information consult our “Using Prompts” guide: https://dash.readme.com/project/vcita-developers-hub/v3.0/docs/using-prompts

type.description: The type of message sent to the bot (free text or a saved prompt template). A saved prompt can include reusable instructions that can be retrieved from BizAI for advanced functionality.

content.description: An object representing the content sent to the bot. Each prompt type must have its own object (“Text Content Object” for “text” and “Prompt Content Object” for “prompt”).

streaming.description: Stream response option. If true, the response will be streamed to the client. If false, the response will be sent as a single message

delta.description: Token that is part of the content of the message

finish_reason.description: The reason the stream has finished
